intro: Castela galapageia f. albemarlensis, commonly known as the white-flowered castela, is a rare and unique plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of the islands. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
